Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Partecipazione al comitato editoriale (responsabile delle voci di teoria economica) del "Dizionario di Economia Civile" (a cura di Luigino Bruni e Stefano Zamagni), Roma, Città Nuova Editrice,2009

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE: “The Paradoxes of Happiness In Economics”. University of Milan-Bicocca (Milan). Keynote Speakers: Robert Frank, Richard Easterlin, Luigi Pasinetti, Roberto Scazzieri, Daniel Kahneman.
“The-not-so-fragile fragility of goodness” paper presentato alla conferenza internazionale The Paradoxes of Happiness in Economics, Università di Milano-Bicocca - Milano
“How to Distinguish Between Trust and Reciprocity: A Simple Experiment” paper presentato all’ International Workshop on Behavioral Game Theory and Experiments, Capua.

SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE: “Reciprocity: Theories and Facts”. University of Milan-Bicocca, University of Cagliari, Center for Interdisciplinary Studies in Economics, Psychology and Social Sciences (Verbena). Keynote Speakers: James Andreoni, Cristina Bicchieri, Jon Elster, Armin Falk, Simon Gächter, Vittorio Gallese, Herbert Gintis, Russell Hardin, Kevin A. McCabe, Aldo Rustichini, Joel Sobel.
“Banking with Sentiments. A model of fiduciary relationships in micro-credit programs”, paper presentato al XII World Congress of Social Economy, Amsterdam.
“Social Preferences, Intentions and Empathy”, paper presentato all'International Conference “Economic Child: Behavioral Game Theory and Experiment with Children”, Università di Milano-Bicocca
“Theory of mind, Intention-detection and fairness: An experiment with typically developing and autistic subjects”, paper presentato al Workshop on “Perspectives on the theory of We- thinking”, Trento
“Social Preferences, Intentions and Empathy”, paper presentato alla 3rd Nordic Conference on Behavioral and Experimental Economics, Copenhagen

SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE: “Market and Happiness. Do economic interactions crowd out civic virtues and human capabilities?”. University of Milan-Bicocca (Milan). Keynote Speakers: Martha Nussbaum, Bruno Frey, Irene Van Staveren, Robert Sugden, Stefano Zamagni, Enrico Giovannini.

“Social Preferences, Intentions and Empathy. An experiment with Normally Developing and Autistic Spectrum Disorders Subjects”, paper presentato al CEDEX Seminar, University of Nottingham, Nottingham, UK
"Reciprocating Kindness. An Experimental Investigation". paper presentato all'Economic Science Association, World Meeting, New York, NY

“Information and belief elicitation effects on charitable giving: An artefactual field experiment”, paper presentato alla Behavioral Science and Policy - Network for the Integrated Behavioral Science Annual Conference, Nottingham

SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE: “Public Happiness”. LUMSA University, University of Milan-Bicocca, University of Rome- or Vergata, St. Thomas Aquinas University, Rome, Center for Interdisciplinary Studies in Economics, Psychology and Social Sciences. (Rome). Keynote Speakers: Bruno Frey, Ruut Veenhoven, Carol Ryff, Robert Sugden, Alois Stutzer, Nicholas Theocharakis.

SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE: “Economic Theology,Theological Economics: An interdisciplinary conference”. LUMSA University (Rome). Keynote Speakers: Paul Olsington, Adrian Pabst, John Mildbank, Robert H. Nelson, Tomáš Sedláček, Giacomo Todeschini.

SCIENTIFIC COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE CYCLE of the “Tuscany Towards Expo 2015” Project -- Conference 1: ONCE UPON A TIME THERE WAS THE FUTURE (Firenze, January 17, 2015). Keynote Speakers: • Richard Wilkinson (epidemiologist, University of Nottingham, University College London and University of New York) • Vandana Shiva (ecologist e philosopher, Navdanya International Association) • Stefano Bartolini (economist, University of Siena) • John De Graaf (journalist, Executive Director of Take Back Your Time) • Francesco Sarracino (economist, STATEC, Luxemburg; HSE-LCSR, Russia; GESIS, Germany) • Tim Kasser (psicologo sociale, Knox College) • Donatella Della Porta (political scientist, European Institute of Fiesole) • Colin Crouch (sociologist, University of Warwick) -- Conference 2: FIRMS’ GOVERNANCE AND WELL-BEING AT THE WORKPLACE (Firenze, January 24, 2015). Keynote Speakers: • Anouk Grevin (economist, University of Nantes) • Helena A. Marujo (psychologist, University of Lisbon) • Francesco Sarracino (economist, STATEC, Luxemburg; HSE-LCSR, Russia; GESIS, Germany) • Arne L. Kalleberg (sociologist, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill) -- Conference 3: BIODIVERSITY AND FORMS OF ENTERPRISES (Firenze, January 30, 2015). Keynote Speakers: • Stefano Zamagni (economist, University of Bologna) • André Habish (economist, Katholische Universität Eichstätt-Ingolstadt) • Luigino Bruni (economist, LUMSA-Rome and Sophia UI) -- Conference 4: CIVIL ECONOMY AND PUBLIC HAPPINESS (Firenze, January 31, 2015). Keynote Speakers: • Bruno Frey (economist, Zeppelin University Friedrichshafen) • Ruut Veenhoven (sociologist, Erasmus University Rotterdam) • Jennifer Nedelsky (philosofer, University of Toronto)
“Reciprocity of what in a simple trust game”. paper presentato al Sophia Seminar in Economics and Business, ‘Sophia’ International University Institute
“Trust as a Common Good”, invited public at the “Contemporary Economic Issues” series, University of East Anglia, Norwich (UK)

“¿Nuestras decisiones económicas son siempre racionales? ¿Estamos dispuestos a cooperar?” Invited plenary lecture at the conference “La empresa del s. XXI: Una mirada diferente", Escuela Técnica Superior de Ingeniería de Caminos, Canales y Puertos, Universidad de Granada, Granada (Spain)
“Menu (In)Dependence in the Trust Game” paper presentato all'Economic Science Association, European Meeting, Heidelberg.

“Fiducia è Bene Comune”, Invited lecture at the course “Laboratorio di Responsabilità, Etica e Diritto”, Dipartimento di Economia, Management, Istituzioni, Università degli Studi di Napoli “Federico II”, Napoli
“The Economics of Other-Regarding Behavior”. Invited plenary lecture at 11ième Seminaire Plenier du GRACE, Lyon (FRANCE)
“Lo Sviluppo delle Competenze Decisionali: La Prospettiva della Neuroeconomia”, Invited seminar at “Le frontiere delle neuroscienze” seminars series, Auxilum University, Rome

SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE “Vulnerability and Gift in Economics and Business: An interdisciplinary conference”. ‘Sophia’ International University Institute, HEIRS, GRACE, (Loppiano, Florence). Keynote speakers: Erik Borgman, Tilburg University - John Milbank, University of Nottingham - Domenec Mele, IESE Business School - Pierre Yves Gomez, EM Lyon & GRACE.
“Relationality and Societal Challenges: The Economic Perspective”. Invited plenary lecture at Eco-One International Conference, Budapest
“Responding to (Un)reasonable Request” paper presentato all'Economic Science Association, European Meeting, Bergen
SCIENTIFIC AND ORGANIZING COMMITTEE OF THE CONFERENCE “PRIZES AND VIRTUES: AN INTERDISCIPLINARY WORKSHOP” LUMSA University, Rome – April 10-11, 2017

Responsabilita' di studi e ricerche scie.content: Progetto Europeo Equal “Nuove Officine: strumenti di accesso al credito per le imprese sociali” Fondazione Culturale Banca Etica - Crenos (Centro di ricerche economiche nord-sud) (Coordinatore scientifico unità CRENOS)

Progetto di ricerca e sperimentazione “Il nuovo Welfare locale: verso una prospettiva di integrazione e coprogettazione” Assessorato alla Sanità, Igiene e dell’Assistenza Sociale, Regione Autonoma della Sardegna (Coordinatore scientifico dell'Unità 1: Dipartimento di Economia, Università di Cagliari)

Ministero della Salute – Direzione Generale della Ricerca Scientifica e Tecnologica - Ricerca finalizzata “Strategie per valutare l'impatto delle scelte regionali sulla rete integrata dei servizi” (Coordinatore scientifico Area 1)

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Scholarship in the form of tuition fee exemption (School of Economics and Social Studies – University of East Anglia)
Borsa di studio della Facoltà di Economia dell'Università di Cagliari per la frequenza di un corso di Master all'estero
Borsa di studio (3 annualità) per la frequenza di corsi di specializzazione (PhD) all'estero (Regione Autonoma della Sardegna).
Regione Autonoma della Sardegna Premialità alla ricerca per la produttività scientifica (ex art. 13, L.R. n. 7/2007) 10.000 Euro

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Membro del Collegio dei docenti del Dottorato in Economia delle Università di Cagliari e Sassari
Membro del Collegio dei docenti del Dottorato in Economics dell'Istituto Universitario "Sophia" (Loppiano, Firenze)
Incarico di docenza (Microeconomia Avanzata) al dottorato in Scienze Economiche e Aziendali dell'Università di Cagliari e Sassari
